content:
For the November Houston.pm meeting, Brett Estrade presents Process Management Modules in Perl. The meeting begins on November 12 at 6pm on Zoom. See the announcement for details.

Brett Estrade covers some process management modules in Perl, including MCE and Parallel::ForkManager::Segmented.
title: Process Management Modules in Perl

content:
For the November Houston.pm meeting, Brett Estrade presents Process Management Modules in Perl. The meeting begins on November 12 at 6pm on Zoom. See the announcement for details.

Brett Estrade covers some process management modules in Perl, including MCE and Parallel::ForkManager::Segmented.
title: Process Management Modules in Perl

content:
For the October Houston.pm meeting, Julian Brown presents A /usr/bin/sendmail like perl script that uses SendGrid email delivery service. The meeting begins on October 8 at 6pm on Zoom. Check the website for connection details

Julian Brown will describe a perl script he wrote that uses SendGrid to handle outgoing server email. He'll cover the process, the script, and some DNS configuration.
title: A /usr/bin/sendmail like perl script that uses SendGrid email delivery service

content:
For the September Houston.pm meeting, Brett Estrade presents 2001: How our Grandfathers wrote OO Perl. The meeting begins on September 10 at 6pm on Zoom. Invite information will be forthcoming at Houston.pm.

Brett Estrade will tour the book Object Oriented Perl: A Comprehensive Guide to Concepts and Programming Techniques by Damien Conway. The book shows the old approach to OO in Perl.
title: 2001: How our Grandfathers wrote OO Perl

content:
For the August Houston.pm meeting, James Keenan presents Perl 7: An Opinionated Introduction. The meeting begins on August 13 at 6pm on Zoom. Meeting information can be found at meeting announcement.

James Keenan gives an introduction to the upcoming Perl 7 release. This is a chance to continue evolving Perl into the future, while providing a point to disconnect from some legacy behavior.
title: Perl 7: An Opinionated Introduction

content:
For the July Houston.pm meeting, Todd Rinaldo presents Update on TPCiC, Perl 7, and discussion. The meeting begins on July 9 at 6pm on Zoom. See the mailing list for details.

For this month's remote meeting, Todd Rinaldo will give a summary of where Perl stands today. We'll go on from there to a more general discussion among the teams.
title: Update on TPCiC, Perl 7, and discussion

content:
The June Houston.pm meeting will be a remote social meeting. The meeting begins on June 11 at 6pm over Zoom. The meeting invite is available on the mailing list. Instead of a presentation, we will mostly socialize and talk about whatever seems interesting.

The June Houston.pm social meeting will be held over Zoom. Bring your curiosity and interest in finding out what your fellow Perl Mongers have been up to.
title: June Remote Social Meeting

content:
For the May Houston.pm meeting, We'll be meeting on Zoom (Check the mailing list.) We'll hear from Evan Carroll about a project he's working on, and any other subjects we think to discuss. We'll start at 6pm.

For the May Houston.pm meeting, We'll be meeting on Zoom (Check the mailing list.) We'll hear from Evan Carroll about a project he's working on, and any other subjects we think to discuss. We'll start at 6pm.
title: Remote May Houston.pm Meeting

content:
For the April Houston.pm meeting, Julian Brown presents SQL 101. The meeting begins on April 9 at 6pm. We are going to try for a remote meeting this time. Keep an eye on the mailing list for further details.

Julian Brown covers the basics of SQL in this fundamentals talk.
title: SQL 101

content:
For the March Houston.pm meeting, G. Wade Johnson presents Perl Data Structures: Tips, Tricks, and Traps. The meeting begins on March 12 at 6pm in the cPanel offices at 2550 North Loop West, Suite 4006. We gather in the lobby 30 minutes before.

Making the best use of Perl includes understanding and using its data structures. G. Wade Johnson will present the major Perl data structures, dipping slightly into implementation, but focusing mostly on the effective use of those structures.
title: Perl Data Structures: Tips, Tricks, and Traps

content:
For the February Houston.pm meeting, John Lightsey presents Coverage guided fuzzing the Perl interpreter. The meeting begins on February 13 at 6pm in the Hostgator offices at 5005 Mitchelldale St., Suite 100. We gather in the lobby 30 minutes before.

John Lightsey will present an early version of a talk he has scheduled for The Perl and Raku Conference this year. The talk will cover using fuzzing in analysis of the Perl interpreter. If you have interest in security, Perl, or fuzz testing, this will be the talk for you.
title: Coverage guided fuzzing the Perl interpreter

content:
For the January Houston.pm meeting, Julian Brown leads a discussion on Deploying Perl Applications. The meeting begins on January 9 at 6pm in the cPanel offices at 2550 North Loop West, Suite 4006. We gather in the lobby 30 minutes before.

Except in the case of simple standalone scripts, Perl applications usually consist of multiple modules and the perl executable. In this discussion, we want to cover some of the ways you can deploy a Perl application to any environment.
title: Deploying Perl Applications

content:
For the December Houston.pm meeting, Debbie Campbell presents Code.org. The meeting begins on December 12 at 6pm in the Hostgator offices at 5005 Mitchelldale St., Suite 100. We gather in the lobby 30 minutes before.

Do the children in your life have access to computer science education? What does that even mean, and why should you care?

Come find out at HostGator on Thursday, December 12, 6 pm to 8 pm. No prior computer science skills are necessary, and there will be pizza.

You'll experience a nationally vetted K-12 program that's offered in 180 of the United States' largest school districts, as well as private, parochial, and home schools. Did we mention that it's offered at no cost, thanks to generous donors like Microsoft, Amazon, Facebook, and more?

At the least, you'll leave with ideas to entertain holiday visitors of all ages.

About the Presenter - Debbie Campbell, B.S.E.E., M.R.S., is the Rice University School Mathematics Project Code.org program manager. She is also awfully fond of G. Wade Johnson.
title: Code.org

content:
For the November Houston.pm meeting, Evan Carroll presents Constants: what they provide, and how to mock them and G. Wade Johnson presents Using Regular Expressions. The meeting begins on November 14 at 6pm in the cPanel offices at 2550 North Loop West, Suite 4006. We gather in the lobby 30 minutes before.

The November meeting will include two presentations. Evan Carroll will cover another aspect of testing in Perl with Constants: what they provide, and how to mock them. Afterward, G. Wade Johnson will present another fundamentals topic: Using Regular Expressions.
title: "Constants: what they provide, and how to mock them." and "Using Regular Expressions"

content:
For the October Houston.pm meeting, Evan Carroll presents Cross-language Object-Oriented Mechanics. The meeting begins on October 10 at 6pm in the Hostgator offices at 5005 Mitchelldale St., Suite 100. We gather in the lobby 30 minutes before.

Evan Carroll will cover some of the reasons for using an Object Oriented paradigm when programming. He will show how Perl and a few other languages implement the appropriate concepts.
title: Cross-language Object-Oriented Mechanics

content:
For the September Houston.pm meeting, Julian Brown chairs a Panel Discussion on Object Oriented Programming. The meeting begins on September 12 at 6pm in the cPanel offices at 2550 North Loop West, Suite 4006. We gather in the lobby 30 minutes before.

This panel discussion covers the basics of Object Oriented Programming. Although OO has been the dominant paradigm for the last couple of decades, there are still a number of concepts that people seem to misunderstand. Julian will attempt to wrangle a number of members with many different levels of experience to discuss OO. The goal is to help all of us come to a mutual understanding of various aspects of OO.
title: Panel Discussion on Object Oriented Programming

content:
For the August Houston.pm meeting, G. Wade Johnson presents Basic Unit Testing Concepts in Perl. The meeting begins on August 8 at 6pm in the Hostgator offices at 5005 Mitchelldale St., Suite 100. We gather in the lobby 30 minutes before.

Wade starts with some unit testing basics, introduces some of the Perl unit test frameworks, and then focuses on concepts and tricks to help you get more from your unit tests. While not attempting to cover the whole subject of unit testing, there should be something here for most.
title: Basic Unit Testing Concepts in Perl

content:
For the July Houston.pm meeting, Julian Brown presents Test::Spec, test using a declarative testing framework. The meeting begins on July 11 at 6pm in the cPanel offices at 2550 North Loop West, Suite 4006. We gather in the lobby 30 minutes before.

Julian presents a Perl test module modeled after the Ruby RSpec testing framework.
title: Test::Spec, test using a declarative testing framework

content:
For the June Houston.pm meeting, Julian Brown presents Moving my website toward production. The meeting begins on June 13 at 6pm in the HostGator offices at 5005 Mitchelldale St., Suite 100. We gather in the lobby 30 minutes before.

Julian will spend a few minutes on the state of his current website project, and where he intends to take it. He will elicit input from the attendees.

Julian Brown will spend some time showing and explaining the state of his current website project, and cover where he intends to take it next
title: Moving my website toward production

content:
For the June Houston.pm meeting, Julian Brown presents Moving my website toward production. The meeting begins on June 13 at 6pm in the HostGator offices at 5005 Mitchelldale St., Suite 100. We gather in the lobby 30 minutes before.

Julian will spend a few minutes on the state of his current website project, and where he intends to take it. He will elicit input from the attendees.

Julian Brown will spend some time showing and explaining the state of his current website project, and cover where he intends to take it next
title: Moving my website toward production
